evidence.text: NIH scientists pioneered the rubella vaccine, eradicating a disease that, in the 1960s, killed thousands of babies and left thousands more with lifelong disabilities.

extracted.value: NIH scientists pioneered the rubella vaccine, eradicating a disease that, in the 1960s, killed thousands of babies and left thousands more with lifelong disabilities.

evidence.text: NIH studies led to the discovery of the BRCA mutation, helping countless Americans reduce their risk of breast and ovarian cancer.

extracted.value: NIH studies led to the discovery of the BRCA mutation, helping countless Americans reduce their risk of breast and ovarian cancer.

evidence.text: NIH research fueled the development of treatments for HIV and AIDS, transforming what was once a fatal disease into one with a nearly normal life expectancy.

extracted.value: NIH research fueled the development of treatments for HIV and AIDS, transforming what was once a fatal disease into one with a nearly normal life expectancy.

evidence.text: In Fiscal Year 2024 alone, NIH’s more than $36 billion in awards spurred more than $94 billion in new economic activity—a return of $2.56 for every $1 invested. These investments supported more than 407,000 jobs across every State and the District of Columbia.

extracted.value: In Fiscal Year 2024 alone, NIH’s more than $36 billion in awards spurred more than $94 billion in new economic activity—a return of $2.56 for every $1 invested. These investments supported more than 407,000 jobs across every State and the District of Columbia.

evidence.text: By law, NIH provides much of its support for scientific research and training in the form of grants to outside institutions. Since his inauguration, however, the President has issued a barrage of executive orders prohibiting federal agencies from supporting any initiatives with a perceived nexus to certain subjects he opposes, such as “DEI” and “gender ideology.”

Since his inauguration, however, the President has issued a barrage of executive orders prohibiting federal agencies from supporting any initiatives with a perceived nexus to certain subjects he opposes, such as “DEI” and “gender ideology.”

evidence.text: In Massachusetts, for example, the growing uncertainty has forced the Commonwealth’s flagship public research institution, the University of Massachusetts, to rescind several dozen offers from prospective biomedical-sciences graduate students for the upcoming academic year, decimating its graduate student program and jeopardizing important lines of research and risking adverse generational impacts on public health research and innovation.
